page.title: 16WATER SPORTS
page.content:
{Water Sports Around Lytchett Bay
Approximately six square kilometres or a half of the block is covered by water. {Lytchett Bay}is the largest stretch of water. About two and a half square kilometers is salt marsh. {Rock Lea River}goes through{Lytchett {Bay}into{Poole Harbour. Thus the area supports{leisure {activities}such as angling, windsurfing, sailing and bathing. These are enjoyed by residents and visitors alike. The area also supports much{wildlife including many species of water fowl and many people in the area enjoy watching the birdlife.
